name: ethanol
trans: n. [有化] 乙醇，[有化] 酒精

sentences.english: But the significance of the quarrel goes well beyond ethanol.
sentences.chinese: 但是这场争论的意义远远不止于乙醇问题。

sentences.english: No cars in Brazil run on pure gasoline anymore. The government requires that all vehicles run on blended fuel of about one-quarter ethanol.
sentences.chinese: 如今巴西不再使用单纯靠汽油驱动的汽车，政府要求所有机动车均采用含四分之一乙醇的混合燃料。

sentences.english: This includes construction of 15 ethanol plants with assistance from Brazil.
sentences.chinese: 这包括在巴西的帮助下建设15个乙醇生产厂。

detailed_translations.chinese: [有化] 乙醇，[有化] 酒精
detailed_translations.english: the type of alcohol in alcoholic drinks, which can also be used as a fuel for cars

name: hydrogen
trans: n. [化学] 氢

sentences.english: Water contains hydrogen and oxygen.
sentences.chinese: 水含有氢和氧。

sentences.english: Water can be reduced to oxygen and hydrogen by electrolysis.
sentences.chinese: 水通过电解可以分解为氧和氢。

sentences.english: The first bubbles to escape from the liquid are a mixture of air and hydrogen.
sentences.chinese: 从该液体中最先逸出的气泡是空气和氢的混合物。

detailed_translations.english: Hydrogen is a colourless gas that is the lightest and commonest element in the universe

name: advocate
trans: v. 提倡，拥护；为……辩护 n. 拥护者；辩护者；辩护律师，出庭律师；律师；为（某团体）谋利益者

sentences.english: Extremists were openly advocating violence.
sentences.chinese: 极端主义者公开鼓吹使用暴力。

sentences.english: Mr. Williams is a conservative who advocates fewer government controls on business.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯先生是一位提倡减少政府对商业的控制的保守人士。

detailed_translations.english: If you advocate a particular action or plan, you recommend it publicly
someone who publicly supports someone or something

name: ban
trans: v. 禁止，取缔；（官方）把（某人）逐出某地 n. 禁止，禁令，禁忌；剥夺公民权的判决；诅咒；巴尼（罗马尼亚货币单位） n. (Ban) （美、罗马、克罗地亚）班恩（人名）

sentences.english: Smoking is banned in the building.
sentences.chinese: 大楼内禁止吸烟。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something must not be done, seen, used etc
an official order that prevents something from being used or done

name: immigrate
trans: vi. 移入 vt. 使移居入境

sentences.english: His father and mother immigrated when he was two.
sentences.chinese: 他的父母在他两岁时移民到这里。

detailed_translations.english: to come into a country in order to live there permanently

name: represent
trans: vt. 代表；表现；描绘；回忆；再赠送 vi. 代表；提出异议

sentences.english: Mr Kobayashi was chosen to represent the company at the conference.
sentences.chinese: 小林先生被选中代表公司出席会议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 作为…的代表， 表示， 象征； 描绘， 表现
detailed_translations.english: to officially speak or take action for another person or group of people

name: triathlon
trans: n. 三项全能运动

sentences.english: I’m happy to report that I finished my first sprint triathlon this morning!
sentences.chinese: 我很高兴来汇报今早完成的第一次急速短跑三项全能运动！

detailed_translations.english: a sports competition in which competitors run, swim, and cycle long distances

name: adapt
trans: vt. 使适应；改编 vi. 适应

sentences.english: The ability to adapt is a definite asset in this job.
sentences.chinese: 适应能力是做这份工作的绝对有利条件。

sentences.english: Many children buy books after they have been adapted for television.
sentences.chinese: 许多小孩子都是在书被改编成电视剧之后才去买的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually change your behaviour and attitudes in order to be successful in a new situation

name: adobe
trans: n. （建筑用）黏土，黏土坯；土砖；土砖建筑

sentences.english: ...a few blocks of adobe houses.
sentences.chinese: …几个由土坯房组成的街区。

detailed_translations.english: earth and  straw  that are made into bricks for building houses

name: ancestral
trans: adj. 祖先的；祖传的

sentences.english: ...the family's ancestral home in southern Germany.
sentences.chinese: …这一家在德国南部的祖宅。

detailed_translations.english: You use ancestral to refer to a person's family in former times, especially when the family is important and has property or land that they have had for a long time

name: artifact
trans: n. 人工制品，手工艺品；非自然存在物体（artefact 的另一种拼法）

sentences.english: In the wrong hands this powerful artifact has the ability to unravel the soul.
sentences.chinese: 在错误手这强有力的人工制品有能力解开灵魂。

name: prehistoric
trans: adj. 史前的；陈旧的

sentences.english: prehistoric burial grounds
sentences.chinese: 史前墓地

sentences.english: prehistoric animals
sentences.chinese: 史前动物

detailed_translations.english: relating to the time in history before anything was written down

name: pueblo
trans: n. 普韦布洛（美国科罗拉多州中部一城市）；印第安人村庄

sentences.english: There are several dozen Indian pueblos near Santa Fe.
sentences.chinese: 圣达菲附近有几十个印第安人村庄。

detailed_translations.english: A pueblo is a village, especially in the southwestern United States

name: complex
trans: adj. 复杂的；合成的 n. 复合体；综合设施

sentences.english: a complex system of highways
sentences.chinese: 复杂的公路网

sentences.english: Photosynthesis is a highly complex process.
sentences.chinese: 光合作用是一个非常复杂的过程。

sentences.english: Peter seemed to have an instant understanding of the most complex issues.
sentences.chinese: 再复杂的问题彼得似乎也是一看就明白。

sentences.english: It was a very complex relationship between two complex people.
sentences.chinese: 这是两个复杂的人之间非常复杂的关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由许多部分组成的，复合的；复杂的，难懂的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of many different parts and often difficult to understand

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合体， 集合体； 情结， 夸大的情绪反应
detailed_translations.english: a group of buildings, or a large building with many parts, used for a particular purpose

name: gland
trans: n. 腺 密封压盖

sentences.english: the pituitary gland
sentences.chinese: 脑垂体腺

detailed_translations.english: an organ of the body which produces a substance that the body needs, such as hormones, sweat, or saliva

name: infrasonic
trans: adj. [声] 次声的；次声所产生的

name: organ
trans: n. 器官；机构；风琴；管风琴；嗓音；阴茎 n. （Organ）人名；（英）奥根

sentences.english: the liver, heart, and other internal organs
sentences.chinese: 肝脏、心脏及其他内脏器官

sentences.english: loss of blood flow to his vital organs
sentences.chinese: 他的生命器官供血不足

sentences.english: Extra doses of the hormone caused the animals’ reproductive organs to develop sooner than usual.
sentences.chinese: 额外使用激素使得这些动物的生殖器官比正常情况下发育得更快。

sentences.english: In Arizona, 480 people are waiting for organ transplants.
sentences.chinese: 亚利桑那州有480人在等待器官移植。

sentences.english: dying people who have agreed to be organ donors
sentences.chinese: 愿意捐献器官的垂死的病人

detailed_translations.english: a part of the body, such as the heart or lungs, that has a particular purpose

name: structure
trans: n. 结构；构造；建筑物 vt. 组织；构成；建造

sentences.english: challenges to the existing power structure
sentences.chinese: 对现有权力结构的挑战

sentences.english: A new management structure has been introduced.
sentences.chinese: 已推行一种新的管理结构。

sentences.english: molecular structures
sentences.chinese: 分子结构

detailed_translations.english: the way in which the parts of something are connected with each other and form a whole, or the thing that these parts make up

name: vocal
trans: adj. 歌唱的；声音的，有声的 adj. 直言不讳的 n. 声乐作品；元音 n. Vocal)人名；(西)博卡尔

sentences.english: vocal music
sentences.chinese: 声乐

sentences.english: Allison’s vocal style is influenced by country and blues music.
sentences.chinese: 艾利森的演唱风格受到乡村音乐和布鲁斯音乐的影响。

sentences.english: a female vocal group
sentences.chinese: 女子歌唱组合

detailed_translations.chinese: 喜欢畅所欲言的，直言不讳的；嗓音的，发声的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the voice or to singing
the part of a piece of music that is sung rather than played on an instrument

name: cavalry
trans: n. 骑兵；装甲兵；装甲部队

sentences.english: The Black Prince led a cavalry charge against them.
sentences.chinese: 黑王子带领骑兵向他们冲去。

detailed_translations.english: the part of an army that fights on horses, especially in the past

name: compound
trans: n. [化学] 化合物；混合物；复合词 adj. 复合的；混合的 v. 合成；混合；恶化，加重；和解，妥协

sentences.english: ...the big compound eyes of dragonflies.
sentences.chinese: …蜻蜓的大复眼。

detailed_translations.english: Compound is used to indicate that something consists of two or more parts or things
a substance containing atoms from two or more  elements

detailed_translations.chinese: 使恶化， 加重； 使化合， 使合成
detailed_translations.english: to make a difficult situation worse by adding more problems

name: hostility
trans: n. 敌意；战争行动

sentences.english: The last decade has witnessed a serious rise in the levels of racism and hostility to black and ethnic groups.
sentences.chinese: 过去的10年里，种族主义及对黑人和少数民族的敌意变得更加严重了。

detailed_translations.english: when someone is unfriendly and full of anger towards another person

name: mission
trans: n. 使命，任务；代表团；布道 vt. 派遣；向……传教

sentences.english: He was sent on over 200 missions before being killed in action.
sentences.chinese: 在阵亡之前他奉命执行过200多次军事任务。

sentences.english: US troops taking part in the peacekeeping mission
sentences.chinese: 参与维和任务的美军

sentences.english: a British trade mission to Moscow
sentences.chinese: 派往莫斯科的英国贸易代表团

detailed_translations.english: an important job that involves travelling somewhere, done by a member of the air force, army etc, or by a spacecraft

name: siege
trans: n. 围攻；包围；围城；不断袭击；长期努力 vt. 围攻；包围

sentences.english: The siege lasted almost four months.
sentences.chinese: 这次封锁历时近四个月。

sentences.english: a three-day police siege at a remote country cottage
sentences.chinese: 警方对一座偏僻村舍历时三天的包围

detailed_translations.chinese: 围攻；包围；围城；不断袭击；长期努力
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which an army or the police surround a place and try to gain control of it or force someone to come out of it

name: typhoid
trans: adj. 伤寒的；斑疹伤寒症的 n. 伤寒

sentences.english: a sudden outbreak of typhoid
sentences.chinese: 伤寒的突然爆发

detailed_translations.english: a serious infectious disease that is caused by dirty food or drink

name: Arabic
trans: adj. 阿拉伯的；阿拉伯人的 n. 阿拉伯语

sentences.english: ...the development of modern Arabic literature.
sentences.chinese: ...现代阿拉伯文学的发展。

sentences.english: ...Arabic music.
sentences.chinese: ...阿拉伯音乐。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is Arabic belongs or relates to the language, writing, or culture of the Arabs
the language or writing of the Arabs, which is the main language of North Africa and the Middle East

name: baklava
trans: n. 果仁蜜饼

name: dialect
trans: n. 方言，土话；同源语；行话；个人用语特征 adj. 方言的

sentences.english: the local dialect
sentences.chinese: 当地方言

detailed_translations.chinese: 方言，土话；同源语；行话；个人用语特征
detailed_translations.english: a form of a language which is spoken only in one area, with words or grammar that are slightly different from other forms of the same language

name: pistachio
trans: n. 开心果；阿月浑子果实；阿月浑子树；淡草绿色

sentences.english: pistachio ice cream
sentences.chinese: 开心果冰激凌

detailed_translations.english: a small green nut

name: refugee
trans: n. 难民，避难者；流亡者，逃亡者

sentences.english: Refugees were streaming across the border.
sentences.chinese: 难民正涌过边境。

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["refugee camps"]}
sentences.chinese: 难民营

detailed_translations.chinese: 难民，避难者；流亡者，逃亡者
detailed_translations.english: someone who has been forced to leave their country, especially during a war, or for political or religious reasons

name: Syria
trans: n. 叙利亚共和国

name: bacteria
trans: n. [微] 细菌

sentences.english: Some of these bacteria are actually good for you.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，这些细菌有的对你是很有好处的。

sentences.english: When you eat off the plate, all of those bacteria go into your stomach.
sentences.chinese: 当你吃掉了盘子里的食物时，这些细菌就会进入你的肚子。

sentences.english: But she correctly points out that bacteria are everywhere: on us, in us and all around us.
sentences.chinese: 但是她正确地指出细菌无处不在：在我们身上，在我们体内以及在我们周围。

detailed_translations.english: very small living things, some of which cause illness or disease

name: circulation
trans: n. 流通，传播；循环；发行量；（图书的）借出

sentences.english: Exercise improves the circulation.
sentences.chinese: 运动能促进血液循环。

sentences.english: The Treasury Department plans to remove older coins from circulation and replace them with new ones.
sentences.chinese: 财政部打算收回市面上流通的旧版硬币，以新版取代。

detailed_translations.chinese: 血液循环；（资料、货币等）流通
detailed_translations.english: the movement of blood around your body

name: clot
trans: n. 凝块，黏团（尤指血块）；（非正式）笨蛋，傻瓜 v. （使）凝结成块；覆以粘性物质 n. (Clot) （法、美）克洛（人名）

sentences.english: The patient's blood refused to clot.
sentences.chinese: 病人的血液无法凝结。

detailed_translations.english: if a liquid such as blood or milk clots, or if something clots it, it becomes thicker and more solid
a thick almost solid mass formed when blood or milk dries

name: plasma
trans: n. [等离子] 等离子体；血浆；[矿物] 深绿玉髓

sentences.english: Now there are no gaps, so this is the state of matter, and this was the state of a plasma.
sentences.chinese: 现在没有任何间隙，这样这是物质的状态，而以前是一个等离子体状态。

sentences.english: Scientists think this plasma represents the state of the whole universe justmoments after it was born in the Big Bang, when the universe was extremely hotand dense.
sentences.chinese: 科学家认为这种等离子体代表整个宇宙在它出生的大爆炸之后瞬间的状态，那时的宇宙是非常炎热和致密的。

sentences.english: It receives only in lymph, it gives the emotion through the blood and the right current, what you call, through the nerve system, and it changes to be the same plasma the skin of the man or your nail.
sentences.chinese: 它只会在淋巴中接收，而通过血液和合适的电流来给予情感，也就是通过你们所说的神经系统，然后它就变成与你的皮肤或者指甲相同的等离子体。

detailed_translations.english: a gas that contains about the same numbers of positive and negative electric  charge s  and is found in the sun and most stars

name: pulse
trans: n. [电子] 脉冲；脉搏 vt. 使跳动 vi. 跳动，脉跳

sentences.english: His breathing was shallow and his pulse was weak .
sentences.chinese: 他呼吸很浅，脉搏微弱。

sentences.english: She felt his neck. There was no pulse.
sentences.chinese: 她摸了摸他的颈部，没有脉搏。

sentences.english: Her pulse raced (= beat very quickly ) with excitement.
sentences.chinese: 她激动得脉搏急速跳动。

detailed_translations.english: the regular beat that can be felt, for example at your wrist, as your heart pumps blood around your body
to move or flow with a steady quickbeat or sound

name: virus
trans: n. [病毒] 病毒；恶毒；毒害 n. (Virus)人名；(西)比鲁斯

sentences.english: children infected with the Aids virus
sentences.chinese: 感染艾滋病病毒的儿童

sentences.english: a virus infection
sentences.chinese: 病毒感染

detailed_translations.english: a very small living thing that causes infectious illnesses

name: aggressive
trans: adj. 侵略性的；好斗的；有进取心的；有闯劲的

sentences.english: Jim’s voice became aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆的声音凶了起来。

sentences.english: Teachers apparently expect a certain amount of aggressive behaviour from boys.
sentences.chinese: 老师显然料到男孩子多少会有些好勇斗狠的行为。

sentences.english: A successful businessman has to be aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 成功的实业家必须得有股冲劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑衅的，好斗的；有上进心的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in an angry threatening way, as if you want to fight or attack someone

name: cruel
trans: adj. 残酷的，残忍的；使人痛苦的，让人受难的；无情的，严酷的

sentences.english: His death was a cruel blow .
sentences.chinese: 他的死是个无情的打击。

sentences.english: Sometimes life seems unbearably cruel.
sentences.chinese: 有时候生活残酷得让人无法承受。

detailed_translations.chinese: 残酷的，残忍的；使人痛苦的，让人受难的；无情的，严酷的
detailed_translations.english: making someone suffer or feel unhappy

name: prevention
trans: n. 预防；阻止；妨碍

sentences.english: a fire prevention officer
sentences.chinese: 消防官员

sentences.english: You know what they say, prevention is better than cure (= it is better to stop something bad from happening than to remove the problem once it has happened ) .
sentences.chinese: 正所谓预防胜于治疗。

detailed_translations.english: when something bad is stopped from happening

name: threat
trans: n. 威胁，恐吓；凶兆

sentences.english: Your threats don’t scare me.
sentences.chinese: 你的那些威胁吓不倒我。

sentences.english: threats made against his wife and children
sentences.chinese: 对他妻儿的威胁

sentences.english: Nichols never carried out his threat to resign.
sentences.chinese: 尼科尔斯威胁过要辞职，但从未付诸行动。

sentences.english: The government will not give in to terrorist threats .
sentences.chinese: 政府不会屈服于恐怖分子的威胁。

sentences.english: She dismissed the statement as an empty threat .
sentences.chinese: 她无视这项声明，认为是个空口威胁。

sentences.english: They warned him with veiled threats not to mention anything he had witnessed.
sentences.chinese: 他们话中有话地威胁他不要提及他所目睹的事。

sentences.english: The police are investigating death threats made against the two men.
sentences.chinese: 警方正在调查针对这两名男子的死亡恐吓。

sentences.english: Officials at the school say they received a bomb threat at approximately 11:30 a.m. today.
sentences.chinese: 学校的官员说他们在今天上午11点半左右收到过炸弹恐吓。

detailed_translations.english: a statement in which you tell someone that you will cause them harm or trouble if they do not do what you want

name: violence
trans: n. 暴力；侵犯；激烈；歪曲

sentences.english: There is too much sex and violence on TV these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今电视上性爱和暴力场面太多。

detailed_translations.english: behaviour that is intended to hurt other people physically

name: witness
trans: n. 证人；目击者；证据 vt. 目击；证明；为…作证 vi. 作证人 n. (Witness)人名；(津)威特尼斯

sentences.english: Police have appealed for witnesses to come forward.
sentences.chinese: 警方呼吁目击者站出来。

sentences.english: an eye witness (= someone who sees an event ) to the robbery
sentences.chinese: 抢劫案的一名目击者

detailed_translations.english: someone who sees a crime or an accident and can describe what happened

detailed_translations.chinese: 目击； 为…作证， 证明
detailed_translations.english: used to introduce an example that proves something you have just mentioned

name: commotion
trans: n. 骚动；暴乱

sentences.english: He heard a commotion outside.
sentences.chinese: 他听到外面一阵骚动。

detailed_translations.english: A commotion is a lot of noise, confusion, and excitement

name: fray
trans: v. 磨损，磨松；紧张，烦躁；用头磨 n. 争论；打架；磨损处 n. (Fray) （美、英、法、俄）弗雷（人名）

sentences.english: Three civilians were injured during the fray.
sentences.chinese: 三个平民在冲突中受伤。

sentences.english: The fabric is very fine or frays easily.
sentences.chinese: 这种布料很细，或者说是容易磨损。

sentences.english: The stitching had begun to fray at the edges.
sentences.chinese: 边缘处的针脚已经开始磨损了。

detailed_translations.english: an argument or fight

detailed_translations.chinese: 使磨损；变得令人紧张、急躁
detailed_translations.english: If something such as cloth or rope frays, or if something frays it, its threads or fibres start to come apart from each other and spoil its appearance

name: phenomenon
trans: n. 现象；奇迹；杰出的人才

sentences.english: Homelessness is not a new phenomenon .

detailed_translations.english: something that happens or exists in society, science, or nature, especially something that is studied because it is difficult to understand

trans: vt. 击；打；用拳头连续揍 n. （马鞍的）前鞍桥；球壮末端；（刀把或剑柄的）圆头（等于pommel）

name: summon
trans: vt. 召唤；召集；鼓起；振作

sentences.english: Robert summoned the waiter for the bill.
sentences.chinese: 罗伯特召唤服务员结账。

sentences.english: It took her a full month to summon the courage to tell her mother.
sentences.chinese: 她用了整整一个月的时间才鼓起勇气告诉了母亲。

detailed_translations.english: to order someone to come to a place

name: visualize
trans: vt. 形象，形象化；想像，设想 vi. 显现

sentences.english: I tried to visualize the house while he was describing it.
sentences.chinese: 我一边听他描述，一边想象那房子的样子。

detailed_translations.english: to form a picture of someone or something in your mind

name: authorize
trans: vt. 批准，认可；授权给；委托代替

sentences.chinese: 授权传记

detailed_translations.english: to give official permission for something

trans: n. 战场；沙场

sentences.english: ...the struggle to save America's Civil War battlefields.
sentences.chinese: …保存美国内战战场的努力。

detailed_translations.english: a place where a battle is being fought or has been fought

name: found
trans: vt. 创立，建立；创办 v. 找到（find的过去分词）

sentences.english: Founded in 1935 in Ohio, Alcoholics Anonymous is now a world-wide organization.
sentences.chinese: 嗜酒者互诫协会1935年创立于俄亥俄州，现在是一个世界性的组织。

sentences.english: Eton College was founded by Henry VI in 1440.
sentences.chinese: 伊顿公学于1440年由亨利六世创办。

detailed_translations.english: to start something such as an organization, company, school, or city, often by providing the necessary money

name: tend
trans: vi. 趋向，倾向；照料，照顾 vt. 照料，照管

sentences.english: Sofia was in the bedroom tending to her son.
sentences.chinese: 索菲娅在卧室里照料她的儿子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 照管， 照料， 护理
detailed_translations.english: to look after someone or something
if something tends to happen, it happens often and is likely to happen again

name: volunteer
trans: n. 志愿者；志愿兵 adj. 志愿的 vi. 自愿 vt. 自愿

sentences.english: Most of the relief work was done by volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 大部分救援工作都由志愿人员完成。

sentences.english: I volunteered my services as a driver.
sentences.chinese: 我主动提出来当司机。

detailed_translations.english: someone who does a job willingly without being paid
to offer to do something without expecting any reward, often something that other people do not want to do

name: cryptographic
trans: adj. 关于暗号的，用密码写的

name: decipher
trans: v. 破译，译解；辨认，解释，理解 n. 密电（或密信的）译文

sentences.english: She studied the envelope, trying to decipher the handwriting.
sentences.chinese: 她仔细地看信封，试图辨认上面的字迹。

detailed_translations.chinese: 解释（过去式deciphered，过去分词deciphered，现在分词deciphering，第三人称单数deciphers，名词decipherer，形容词decipherable）；译解
detailed_translations.english: to find the meaning of something that is difficult to read or understand

name: discrimination
trans: n. 歧视；区别，辨别；识别力

sentences.english: laws to prevent discrimination
sentences.chinese: 防止歧视的法律

sentences.english: shape discrimination
sentences.chinese: 形状识别力

detailed_translations.english: the practice of treating one person or group differently from another in an unfair way

name: encryption
trans: n. 加密；加密术

sentences.english: You have not chosen an encryption key.
sentences.chinese: 您还没有选择一个加密密钥。

sentences.english: I really like this feature, but after adding it to the installation the request to enter the encryption key is far from obvious.
sentences.chinese: 我非常喜欢这个特性，但是在安装是勾选了这个设置后，输入加密密钥的请求却无从找寻。

name: Navajo
trans: n. 纳瓦霍人（美国最大的印第安部落）

name: app
trans: abbr. （计算机）应用程序 (application) n. (App) （美、德、巴）阿普（人名）

name: comment
trans: n. 评论；意见；批评；描述 vt. 发表评论；发表意见 vi. 为……作评语 n. (Comment) （美、瑞、法）科门特 （人名）

sentences.english: Have you any comment to make about the cause of the disaster?
sentences.chinese: 你对发生灾难的原因有何评论？

sentences.english: The results are a clear comment on government education policy.
sentences.chinese: 这些结果是对政府教育政策明显的批评。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion that you express about someone or something

name: post
trans: n. 岗位；邮件；标杆 vt. 张贴；公布；邮递；布置 vi. 快速行进 n. (Post)人名；(英、西、捷、瑞典、荷)波斯特

sentences.english: a fence post
sentences.chinese: 篱笆桩

sentences.english: The exam results were posted on the bulletin board yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 考试成绩昨天在布告板上贴出来了。

detailed_translations.english: a strong upright piece of wood, metal etc that is fixed into the ground, especially to support something
to put up a public notice about something on a wall or notice board

name: selfie
trans: n. 自拍照（=selfy）

name: text
trans: n. [计] 文本；课文；主题 vt. 发短信

sentences.english: a chemistry text
sentences.chinese: 化学课本

detailed_translations.english: a textbook
to send someone a written message on a  mobile phone

name: torture
trans: n. 折磨；拷问；歪曲 v. 折磨；拷问；歪曲

sentences.english: He died after five days of excruciating torture.
sentences.chinese: 遭受了五天的严刑拷打之后，他死了。

sentences.english: The waiting must be torture for you.
sentences.chinese: 这样的等待对你来说肯定是一种煎熬。

sentences.english: Political opponents of the regime may be tortured.
sentences.chinese: 这个政权的政治异己可能会遭受酷刑。

detailed_translations.english: an act of deliberately hurting someone in order to force them to tell you something, to punish them, or to be cruel
to deliberately hurt someone in order to force them to give you information, to punish them, or to be cruel

name: committee
trans: n. 委员会

sentences.english: a committee meeting
sentences.chinese: 委员会会议

detailed_translations.english: a group of people chosen to do a particular job, make decisions etc

name: Senate
trans: n. 参议院，上院；（古罗马的）元老院

name: statesman
trans: n. 政治家；国务活动家

sentences.english: a respected elder statesman
sentences.chinese: 一位受人尊敬的政界元老

detailed_translations.english: a political or government leader, especially one who is respected as being wise and fair

name: veteran
trans: n. 老兵；老手；富有经验的人；老运动员 adj. 经验丰富的；老兵的

sentences.english: He is a veteran of the last revolution in medical technology, gene therapy, which, after some hyped expectations in the 1990s, fell into disfavor after some unsuccessful trials.
sentences.chinese: 他是基因治疗这项最新医学技术的老手，经过了1990年代的兴奋期和之后几次失败的实验后，基因治疗技术已经失宠了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been a soldier, sailor etc in a war

name: activism
trans: n. 行动主义；激进主义

sentences.english: The constant buzz of shared activity and knowledge gives rise to constant innovation and activism.
sentences.chinese: 共同活动和知识的不断传播带来了不断的创新和激进主义。

sentences.english: The baby boomers, who entered adulthood promising a lifetime of activism, have been a politically undistinguished generation.
sentences.chinese: 出生于生育高峰的人，在成年后承诺行动主义，只是一代政治上平庸的一代。

sentences.english: Japanese bosses gripe about activism, yet privately concede that the pressure is spurring many firms to increase returns to shareholders.
sentences.chinese: 日本的老板抱怨激进主义，然而，私下却承认这种压力刺激了很多公司给股东增加了投资回报。

detailed_translations.chinese: 行动主义； 激进主义
detailed_translations.english: Activism is the process of campaigning in public or working for an organization in order to bring about political or social change

name: agricultural
trans: adj. 农业的；农艺的

sentences.english: Farmers struggling for survival strip the forests for agricultural land.
sentences.chinese: 为生存而挣扎的农民们把森林伐光来作农业用地。

detailed_translations.english: Agricultural means involving or relating to agriculture

name: minority
trans: n. 少数民族；少数派；未成年

sentences.english: Gaelic is still spoken in Ireland by a tiny minority.
sentences.chinese: 爱尔兰仍有极少数人在说盖尔语。

detailed_translations.english: a small group of people or things within a much larger group

name: prejudice
trans: n. 偏见；侵害 vt. 损害；使有偏见

sentences.english: Women still face prejudice in the workplace.
sentences.chinese: 女性在职场中仍然面临歧视。

sentences.english: It takes a long time to overcome these kinds of prejudices.
sentences.chinese: 战胜这些偏见需要假以时日。

sentences.english: There was concern that reports in the media would prejudice the jury.
sentences.chinese: 有人担心媒体的报道会影响陪审团的公正性。

to influence someone so that they have an unfair or unreasonable opinion about someone or something

name: union
trans: n. 联盟，协会；工会；联合

sentences.english: Are you planning to join the union?
sentences.chinese: 你打算加入工会吗？

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["union members"]}
sentences.chinese: 工会会员

detailed_translations.english: an organization formed by workers to protect their rights

trans: n. [数] 精确度，准确性

sentences.chinese: 他传球准确无误。

sentences.chinese: 他们怀疑档案中信息的正确性。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being exact or correct; the ability to do sth skilfully without making mistakes

sentences.chinese: “明天我要去阿普尔比。”“太巧了！我也要去那里。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 巧合， 巧事； 一致， 符合
detailed_translations.english: when two things happen at the same time, in the same place, or to the same people in a way that seems surprising or unusual

name: obscured
trans: v. 隐藏，遮蔽；（使）费解；（使）相形见绌（obscure 的过去式及过去分词） adj. 遮蔽的，湮没的

trans: n. 轨道；眼眶；势力范围；生活常规 vi. 盘旋；绕轨道运行 vt. 绕…轨道而行

sentences.chinese: 火星和地球的轨道随着时间而发生改变。

detailed_translations.english: the curved path travelled by an object which is moving around another much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc
to travel in a curved path around a much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc

trans: adj. 局部的；偏爱的；不公平的

sentences.chinese: 那次展会只获得部分成功。

sentences.chinese: 部分解决牛津地区交通拥堵问题的方法

sentences.chinese: 销售额比预期低5%。

sentences.english: As Liz had predicted , the rumours were soon forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 正如利兹所预料的，流言很快就被淡忘了。

sentences.chinese: 但是我是一名建筑师。

sentences.english: They commissioned an architect to design the new library.
sentences.chinese: 他们委托一位建筑师设计这座新图书馆。

sentences.english: The building was constructed from the design of that architect.
sentences.chinese: 这幢大楼是按那位建筑师的设计建造的。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to design buildings

sentences.english: I’ve got a few thousand dollars I’m looking to invest.
sentences.chinese: 我有几千美元想作投资。

sentences.english: It was very difficult to leave a home we had invested so much in.
sentences.chinese: 那个家我们投入得太多，要离开真的很难。

detailed_translations.english: to buy shares, property, or goods because you hope that the value will increase and you can make a profit

trans: n. 摩天楼，超高层大楼；特别高的东西

sentences.chinese: 那幢摩天大楼高耸入云。

sentences.english: The majesty of the skyscraper awed me .
sentences.chinese: 这幢摩天大厦的雄伟气势令我惊叹。

sentences.english: Suddenly, a top needle of a skyscraper is pressing toward him. He fails to dodge and bumps heavily on the concrete needle.
sentences.chinese: 突然，一座摩天大厦的尖型顶柱朝他逼来，他躲避不及，重重地撞在混凝土顶柱上。

trans: n. [建] 尖顶；尖塔；螺旋 vi. 螺旋形上升 vt. 给…加塔尖 n. (Spire)人名；(德)施皮雷；(法)斯皮尔

sentences.chinese: …伸出树梢的教堂尖顶。

detailed_translations.english: a roof that rises steeply to a point on top of a tower, especially on a church

name: steel
trans: n. 钢铁；钢制品；坚固 vt. 钢化；使冷酷 adj. 钢制的；钢铁业的；坚强的 n. (Steel)人名；(德)施特尔；(英)斯蒂尔

sentences.english: a steel bridge
sentences.chinese: 钢铁大桥

sentences.english: stainless steel(= steel that does not change colour ) knives
sentences.chinese: 不锈钢小刀

detailed_translations.english: strong metal that can be shaped easily, consisting of iron and  carbon

name: commemorate
trans: vt. 庆祝，纪念；成为…的纪念

sentences.english: a parade to commemorate the town’s bicentenary
sentences.chinese: 庆祝该镇建立200周年的游行

detailed_translations.english: to do something to show that you remember and respect someone important or an important event in the past

name: dedicate
trans: vt. 致力；献身；题献

sentences.english: The actress now dedicates herself to children’s charity work.
sentences.chinese: 这名女演员现在致力于儿童慈善工作。

detailed_translations.english: to give all your attention and effort to one particular thing

name: dominate
trans: vt. 控制；支配；占优势；在…中占主要地位 vi. 占优势；处于支配地位

sentences.english: The industry is dominated by five multinational companies.
sentences.chinese: 这个行业受五家跨国公司控制。

sentences.english: New Orleans dominated throughout the game.
sentences.chinese: 新奥尔良队自始至终都控制着这场比赛。

sentences.english: Her loud voice totally dominated the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 她的大嗓门完全主导着这场谈话。

sentences.english: Education issues dominated the election campaign.
sentences.chinese: 教育问题成了这次选举活动的主要辩题。

detailed_translations.english: to control someone or something or to have more importance than other people or things

name: legacy
trans: n. 遗赠，遗产

sentences.english: She received a small legacy from her aunt.
sentences.chinese: 她从姨妈那里继承了一小笔遗产。

detailed_translations.chinese: 遗产，遗赠；先人(或过去)留下的东西
detailed_translations.english: money or property that you receive from someone after they die

name: spectator
trans: n. 观众；旁观者

sentences.chinese: 这场比赛吸引了四万多名观众。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is watching an event or game

name: strenuous
trans: adj. 紧张的；费力的；奋发的；艰苦的；热烈的

sentences.english: a strenuous climb
sentences.chinese: 艰难的攀登

sentences.english: The doctor advised Ken to avoid strenuous exercise.
sentences.chinese: 医生建议肯避免剧烈运动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 紧张的；费力的；奋发的；艰苦的；热烈的
detailed_translations.english: needing a lot of effort or strength

name: destructive
trans: adj. 破坏的；毁灭性的；有害的，消极的

sentences.english: the destructive power of modern weapons
sentences.chinese: 现代武器的破坏力

detailed_translations.english: causing damage to people or things

name: drainage
trans: n. 排水；排水系统；污水；排水面积

sentences.english: A handful of pebbles in the bottom of a flowerpot will help drainage.
sentences.chinese: 在花盆底下放一把鹅卵石能够帮助排水。

sentences.english: a plan to improve the town’s drainage system
sentences.chinese: 改善城里排水系统的计划

detailed_translations.english: the process or system by which water or waste liquid flows away

name: ecosystem
trans: n. 生态系统

sentences.english: ...the forest ecosystem.
sentences.chinese: …森林生态系统。

detailed_translations.english: all the animals and plants in a particular area, and the way in which they are related to each other and to their environment

name: floodplain
trans: n. 泛滥平原

sentences.english: Adgantole was a sour-smelling, dusty village beside the Awash River floodplain.
sentences.chinese: 阿甘图尔一处闻起来有些酸臭到处都是灰尘的村庄，就坐落在阿瓦什河的泛滥平原上。

sentences.english: It sprawled across thousands of square kilometres of floodplain where the Euphrates and Tigris rivers divided into a network of tributaries meandering and pulsating south to the Arabian sea.
sentences.chinese: 在幼发拉底河与底格里斯河径分为向南入血脉搏动流入阿拉伯海的蜿蜒河网处，泛滥平原地貌绵延了数千平方公里。

name: hurricane
trans: n. 飓风，暴风

sentences.english: I still remember a hurricane that hit us thirty years ago.
sentences.chinese: 我还记得三十年前袭击我们的一次飓风。

sentences.english: Our love is not fierce, not hot, but despite the tsunami hurricane, also vowed.
sentences.chinese: 我们的爱，不剧烈，不炙热，可是任凭海啸飓风，也矢志不渝。

sentences.english: If an earthquake, hurricane, winter storm, or other disaster strikes your community, you might not have access to food , water, and electricity for days or even weeks.
sentences.chinese: 如果有地震、飓风、暴风雪或其他的灾害突袭你的家园，你可能会好几天甚至好几个星期都得不到食物、水和电。

detailed_translations.english: a storm that has very strong fast winds and that moves over water

name: precipitation
trans: n. [化学] 沉淀，[化学] 沉淀物；降水；冰雹；坠落；鲁莽

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 沉淀，[化学] 沉淀物；降水；冰雹；坠落；鲁莽
detailed_translations.english: rain, snow etc that falls on the ground, or the amount of rain, snow etc that falls

name: adapted
trans: adj. 适合的 v. 使适应，改编（adapt的过去式）

sentences.english: The camel's feet, well adapted for dry sand, are useless on mud.
sentences.chinese: 骆驼的脚十分适合干旱沙地，但在泥地上毫无用处。

name: cycle
trans: n. 循环；周期；自行车；整套；一段时间 vt. 使循环；使轮转 vi. 循环；骑自行车；轮转

sentences.english: a woman’s menstrual cycle
sentences.chinese: 女性的月经周期

detailed_translations.chinese: 自行车、 摩托车； 循环
detailed_translations.english: a number of related events that happen again and again in the same order

name: devastation
trans: n. 毁坏，荒废

sentences.english: The war brought massive devastation and loss of life to the region.
sentences.chinese: 战争给该地区造成巨大的破坏以及生命的丧失。

detailed_translations.english: Devastation is severe and widespread destruction or damage

name: stewardship
trans: n. 管理工作；管事人的职位及职责

name: wildfire
trans: n. 野火，烈火；希腊火；高度易燃物质，燃烧剂；鬼火

trans: n. 废除；废止

trans: n. 自传；自传文学

sentences.chinese: 克莱说，一项好的法律应该是让逃亡的奴隶回到他们的主人手中。

someone who is trying to avoid being caught by the police

trans: n. 读写能力；精通文学

sentences.english: a new adult literacy campaign

detailed_translations.chinese: 识字， 有文化， 读写能力
detailed_translations.english: the state of being able to read and write

sentences.english: Without the fungi, this would be just another sandbar.
sentences.chinese: 如果没有真菌，这里将成为另一个沙洲。

sentences.english: But without fungi we would not have gardens, houses or even feet at all.
sentences.chinese: 但是，如果没有真菌，我们就不会有花园、住宅，甚至脚。

sentences.english: Some of those carbon products transfer from the roots to symbiotic fungi and soil microbes, which store the carbon in the soil as humus.

trans: n. 杀真菌剂

sentences.english: For one thing, they’re not confined to rats or to the fungicide he fed them.
sentences.chinese: 一方面，他们不局限于他所喂养的老鼠及他喂给老鼠的杀菌剂。

sentences.english: Spraying an iprodione fungicide on the nests after they’re taken out of the nesting boards “reduced chalkbrood levels by up to 50 percent—with no measurable loss of young,” she reports.
sentences.chinese: 她报告说，把巢穴从巢套板上拆下来用杀菌剂异菌脲喷洒后“白垩病发病率就会减少50%——没有检测到幼虫死亡。”

sentences.english: The environmental exposure doesn’t have to be as extreme as chowing down on a fungicide.
sentences.chinese: 环境暴露必定不像大量食入杀菌剂一样。

sentences.chinese: 有一些品种的种子发芽快，所以差不多每天都要察看一下。

trans: n. 有机体；生物体；微生物

sentences.chinese: 一切生物都要适应环境条件的变化。

sentences.english: Genes operate together in determining the characteristics of an individual organism.

detailed_translations.english: an animal, plant, human, or any other living thing

name: reproduce
trans: vt. 复制；再生；生殖；使…在脑海中重现 vi. 复制；繁殖

sentences.chinese: 这本精美的书里翻印了克里木特的艺术作品。

trans: n. 孢子 vi. 长孢子

sentences.english: The cation penetrates the spore.
sentences.chinese: 这种阳离子能透入孢子。

sentences.english: Salicylic acid (SA) has no inhibition in growth of hyphae, and no obvious influence on spore germination.
sentences.chinese: 水杨酸对焦枯病菌菌丝的生长无抑制作用，对孢子萌发的影响不显著。

sentences.english: Don't flee battles just because they seem pointless to you. A horde of spore plants when you can shoot two targeted shots per round is still good xp!
sentences.chinese: 不用逃避战斗，因为他们似乎对你无所谓。一大批孢子植物时，你可以各个击破它们并得到一些经验值！

sentences.chinese: 这就是天文学的起源。

sentences.english: You could study astronomy , or space engineering , and be good at it.
sentences.chinese: 你可以学习天文学，或是空间工程学，可以学的很棒。

sentences.chinese: 一个把山谷淹掉来建造水坝的极具争议的计划

sentences.english: He is a controversial figure (= person who does controversial things ) in the art world.
sentences.chinese: 他是艺术界极具争议的人物。

sentences.chinese: 这种抗癌新药是一个革命性突破。

sentences.english: a revolutionary new drug
sentences.chinese: 一种革命性的新药

someone who joins in or supports a political or social revolution

trans: [天] 太阳系

sentences.chinese: 为什么科学家认为可能有某种东西潜藏在太阳系的边缘？

detailed_translations.english: the Sun and the  planets  that go around it

trans: n. 望远镜 v. 叠套缩短；精简，压缩；（车）相撞而嵌进

sentences.chinese: 船长正在调他的望远镜。

sentences.chinese: 借助望远镜可以看出在地平线上有一只船。

sentences.chinese: 布拉纳因他对莎士比亚的《亨利五世》的荧幕改编而获了两次奖。

sentences.chinese: 负责环境事务的政府部长

sentences.chinese: 热带雨林

sentences.english: tropical fruit

sentences.chinese: 轰炸

sentences.chinese: A 级鸡蛋必须大小相同。

sentences.chinese: 风从东北方向吹来。

sentences.chinese: 该国目前正面临一场经济危机。

sentences.english: The Prime Minister was criticized for the way in which he handled the crisis .
sentences.chinese: 首相处理危机的方式遭到了批评。

sentences.english: the current debt crisis
sentences.chinese: 当前的债务危机

sentences.english: a major political crisis
sentences.chinese: 重大的政治危机

sentences.english: I was relieved that we had averted yet another financial crisis .
sentences.chinese: 我如释重负，我们又避免了一场财政危机。

sentences.english: Oil companies were heavily criticized when they made large profits during the oil crisis of the 1970s.
sentences.chinese: 石油公司因在20世纪70年代的石油危机中赚取了丰厚利润而受到严厉抨击。

sentences.english: The car industry is now in crisis .
sentences.chinese: 汽车工业现在正处于危机之中。

sentences.english: He doesn’t seem to be very good at crisis management .
sentences.chinese: 他好像不大擅长处理危机。

sentences.chinese: …过去18年来干旱和饥荒致死达两百万人的一个国家。

sentences.chinese: 有人担心地下水可能会遭污染。

sentences.chinese: 包尔湖的水被用来灌溉该地区。

name: resource

sentences.chinese: 加拿大丰富的矿产资源

sentences.english: a country rich in natural resources
sentences.chinese: 自然资源丰富的国家

sentences.chinese: 营火继续燃烧了几个钟头

sentences.chinese: 在西班牙南部的马拉噶镇，一个女人把一个东西投入篝火中。

sentences.chinese: 其中一个人这样对我说：当你写的时候，你点燃了一簇精神世界的篝火。

sentences.chinese: 斯旺西音乐艺术节

sentences.chinese: 一块两英亩的土地

sentences.chinese: 一块菜地

to make a secret plan to harm a person or organization, especially a political leader or government

name: rebellion
trans: n. 叛乱；反抗；谋反；不服从

sentences.english: an armed rebellion
sentences.chinese: 武装叛乱

detailed_translations.english: an organized attempt to change the government or leader of a country, using violence

name: treason
trans: n. [法] 叛国罪；不忠

sentences.english: The defendant was convicted of high treason (= treason of the worst kind ) and sentenced to death.
sentences.chinese: 被告被判犯有严重叛国罪，并处以死刑。

detailed_translations.english: the crime of being disloyal to your country or its government, especially by helping its enemies or trying to remove the government using violence

name: bedrock
trans: n. [地质] 基岩；根底；基本原理

sentences.english: Marriage and children are the bedrock of family life.
sentences.chinese: 婚姻和子女是家庭生活的基础。

detailed_translations.chinese: 基础， 根基； 基岩
detailed_translations.english: the basic ideas, features, or facts on which something is based

name: divert
trans: vt. 转移；使…欢娱；使…转向 vi. 转移 n. (Divert)人名；(法)迪韦尔

sentences.english: Northbound traffic will have to be diverted onto minor roads.
sentences.chinese: 北行车辆将不得不绕次要道路行驶。

sentences.english: The war diverted people's attention away from the economic situation.
sentences.chinese: 战争把民众的注意力从经济状况上移开了。

detailed_translations.english: to make sb/sth change direction

name: impressed
trans: adj. 印象深刻的；外加的；受感动的；了不起的

detailed_translations.chinese: 被打动的， 被感动的

name: parched
trans: adj. 焦的；炎热的；炒过的；干透的；非常口渴的 v. 烘干；使极渴（parch的过去分词）

name: reservoir
trans: n. 水库；蓄水池

sentences.english: All these earthquakes happened when the water level in Zipingpu reservoir was low.
sentences.chinese: 所有这些地震都发生在紫坪铺水库水位很低的时候。

detailed_translations.english: a lake, especially an artificial one, where water is stored before it is supplied to people’s houses

name: benign
trans: adj. 良性的；和蔼的，亲切的；吉利的 n. (Benign)人名；(俄)贝尼根

sentences.english: He shook his head in benign amusement.
sentences.chinese: 他被逗乐了，和蔼地摇了摇头。

detailed_translations.chinese: 良性的；和蔼的，亲切的；吉利的
detailed_translations.english: kind and gentle

name: desolation
trans: n. 孤寂；悲哀，忧伤；荒芜，荒凉；废墟；凄凉

sentences.english: We looked out upon a scene of desolation and ruin.
sentences.chinese: 我们向外望着一片荒凉、破败的景象。

detailed_translations.english: If you refer to desolation in a place, you mean that it is empty and frightening, for example, because it has been destroyed by a violent force or army

name: meander
trans: v. （河流、道路等）蜿蜒，曲折前行；漫步，闲逛，徘徊；漫谈，闲聊；（文章）行文散漫 n. 河流（或道路）弯道，河曲；漫游

sentences.english: We took a gravel road that meandered through farmland.
sentences.chinese: 我们走上了一条蜿蜒穿越农田的石子路。

detailed_translations.english: to walk somewhere in a slow relaxed way rather than take the most direct way possible

name: radiant
trans: adj. 辐射的；容光焕发的；光芒四射的 n. 光点；发光的物体

sentences.english: She looked radiant in a white silk dress.
sentences.chinese: 她身穿白色真丝礼服，看上去光彩照人。

sentences.english: a radiant smile
sentences.chinese: 灿烂的笑容

detailed_translations.chinese: 辐射的；容光焕发的；光芒四射的
detailed_translations.english: full of happiness and love, in a way that shows in your face and makes you look attractive

name: sensibility
trans: n. 情感；敏感性；感觉；识别力

sentences.english: her religious sensibilities
sentences.chinese: 她的宗教感情

detailed_translations.chinese: 情感；敏感性；感觉；识别力
detailed_translations.english: the way that someone reacts to particular subjects or types of behaviour

name: vagabond
trans: n. 流浪者；无业游民；（旧）流氓，无赖 adj. 流浪的；流浪者的；浪荡的；漂泊的 v. 到处流浪

sentences.english: From that time onwards he continued his life as a vagabond mainly as what he himself calls a ‘soldier of fortune’.
sentences.chinese: 从那以后，他继续着流浪的生活，正如他自己对自己所称呼的那样“命运战士”。

sentences.english: They had to live a kind of bohemian life, the life of a vagabond; that was the only possibility for them to be creative.
sentences.chinese: 他们必须去过一种波西米亚式的生活方式，一种流浪汉的生活方式，那是他们获得创造性的唯一可能性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 流浪的；流浪者的；浪荡的；漂泊的

detailed_translations.english: someone who has no home and travels from place to place

name: advertisement
trans: n. 广告，宣传

sentences.english: They put an advertisement in ‘The Morning News’, offering a high salary for the right person.
sentences.chinese: 他们在《晨报》上刊登了一则启事，出高薪寻找合适的人选。

sentences.english: The organizers of the concert had taken out a full page advertisement in ‘The New York Times’.
sentences.chinese: 音乐会筹办者在《纽约时报》上刊登了整版广告。

sentences.english: Only a handful of people answered the advertisement .
sentences.chinese: 只有寥寥数人对该广告作出了回应。

detailed_translations.english: a picture, set of words, or a short film, which is intended to persuade people to buy a product or use a service, or that gives information about a job that is available, an event that is going to happen etc

name: analyze
trans: vt. 对…进行分析，分解（等于analyse）

sentences.english: How do you analyze this change?
sentences.chinese: 你该如何分析这种变化？

sentences.english: You have to hoover anything before you can analyze it.
sentences.chinese: 在你不具备分析能力之前，你只得胡乱吸收你所能学到的东西。

sentences.english: We should learn to discern and analyze the essentials of complicated questions.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该学会认识和分析复杂问题的本质。

name: appeal
trans: n. 呼吁，恳求；上诉，申诉；吸引力，感染力，魅力；启发，打动 v. 呼吁，恳求；上诉，申诉，诉请裁决；对……有吸引力，有感染力；启发，劝说，打动

sentences.english: The girl’s family have made a public appeal for help to try and catch her killer.
sentences.chinese: 那名遇害女孩的家人吁请公众协助捉拿凶手。

sentences.english: an appeal to the European Court of Human Rights
sentences.chinese: 向欧洲人权法庭提出的上诉

sentences.english: Farmers have appealed to the government for help.
sentences.chinese: 农场主请求政府帮助。

sentences.english: She is not happy with the decision and plans to appeal.
sentences.chinese: 她不服判决，打算上诉

detailed_translations.english: an urgent request for something important
to make a serious public request for help, money, information etc

name: discontent
trans: n. 不满 adj. 不满的 vt. 使不满

sentences.english: Remember not to mention your discontent.
sentences.chinese: 记住，不要提到你对工作的不满。

sentences.english: Of all the workers in the country bituminous miners probably had best grounds for discontent.
sentences.chinese: 在全国所有的工人中，可能烟煤矿工不满的理由最充分。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being unhappy and not satisfied with the situation you are in

name: media
trans: n. 媒体；媒质（medium的复数）；血管中层；浊塞音；中脉

sentences.english: The scandal was widely reported in the national media .
sentences.chinese: 这一丑闻在全国媒体上被广泛报道。

sentences.english: The role of the news media in forming public opinion is very important.
sentences.chinese: 新闻媒体对于社会舆论的形成具有非常重要的作用。

sentences.english: The 11-day trial generated intense media interest .
sentences.chinese: 11天的审讯引起了媒体的高度关注。

sentences.english: A great deal of media hype surrounded the release of the group’s latest CD.
sentences.chinese: 媒体对这个组合最新唱片的发行进行了大肆炒作。

sentences.english: There will be another war somewhere else and the whole international media circus will move on.
sentences.chinese: 别的地方还会有战争，全球的媒体又会一窝蜂地拥过去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 新闻媒介， 传播媒介
detailed_translations.english: all the organizations, such as television, radio, and newspapers, that provide news and information for the public, or the people who do this work

name: product
trans: n. 产品；结果；[数] 乘积；作品

sentences.english: The London factory assembles the finished product .
sentences.chinese: 伦敦工厂组装成品。

sentences.english: He works in marketing and product development.
sentences.chinese: 他从事营销和产品开发。

sentences.english: Paula was the product of a sheltered middle-class home.
sentences.chinese: 葆拉是备受呵护的中产阶级家庭的产物。

sentences.english: The product of 21 and 16 is 336.

detailed_translations.english: something that is grown or made in a factory in large quantities, usually in order to be sold

name: epidemic
trans: adj. 流行的；传染性的 n. 传染病；流行病；风尚等的流行

sentences.english: Over 500 people died during last year’s flu epidemic.
sentences.chinese: 去年流感大暴发期间有五百多人死亡。

detailed_translations.english: a large number of cases of a disease that happen at the same time

name: nutrition
trans: n. 营养，营养学；营养品

sentences.english: Nutrition and exercise are essential to fitness and health.
sentences.chinese: 营养和运动是保持健康所必不可少的。

sentences.english: a nutrition expert
sentences.chinese: 营养专家

detailed_translations.english: the process of giving or getting the right type of food for good health and growth

name: poverty
trans: n. 贫困；困难；缺少；低劣

sentences.english: Millions of elderly people live in poverty .
sentences.chinese: 数百万老年人生活在贫困之中。

sentences.english: We need an effective strategy to fight poverty .
sentences.chinese: 我们需要制定一个有效的对策来与贫困作斗争。

sentences.english: continued efforts to alleviate poverty and raise living standards
sentences.chinese: 缓解贫困和提高生活水平的不懈努力

sentences.english: scenes of abject poverty
sentences.chinese: 极度贫困的情景

sentences.english: the causes of urban poverty
sentences.chinese: 造成城市贫困的原因

detailed_translations.english: the situation or experience of being poor

name: apprehensive
trans: adj. 忧虑的；不安的；敏悟的；知晓的

sentences.english: Some had apprehensive looks on their faces.
sentences.chinese: 有些人面带愁容。

detailed_translations.chinese: 忧虑的；不安的；敏悟的；知晓的
detailed_translations.english: worried or nervous about something that you are going to do, or about the future

name: armada
trans: n. （西班牙的）无敌舰队

sentences.english: This armada of robots will be our eyes, ears, arms and legs in space, in the air, and on the ground, capable of responding to their environment without us, to explore and embrace the unknown.
sentences.chinese: 这个机器人舰队将是我们的眼睛、耳朵、手臂和腿，它们分布在太空中、大气层内，以及地面上，在没有我们的情况下也可以对自身所处的环境做出反应，接近并探测未知世界。

detailed_translations.english: An armada is a large group of warships

name: enchanted
trans: adj. 被施魔法的 v. 使着魔（enchant的过去式）

name: mastodon
trans: n. [古生] 乳齿象；庞然大物 adj. 巨大的；庞大的

detailed_translations.english: any extinct elephant-like proboscidean mammal of the genus Mammut (or Mastodon), common in Pliocene times

name: ultimate
trans: adj. 最终的；极限的；根本的 n. 终极；根本；基本原则

sentences.english: The ultimate outcome of the experiment cannot be predicted.
sentences.chinese: 试验的最后结果无法预测。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s ultimate aim is their main and most important aim, that they hope to achieve in the future

name: bebop
trans: n. 比波普爵士乐（爵士音乐的一种）

name: improvise
trans: vt. 即兴创作；即兴表演；临时做；临时提供 vi. 即兴创作；即兴表演；临时凑合

sentences.english: I forgot to bring my notes, so I had to improvise.
sentences.chinese: 我忘了带笔记，只好临时发挥。

detailed_translations.english: to do something without any preparation, because you are forced to do this by unexpected events

name: innovator
trans: n. 改革者，创新者

sentences.english: He is an innovator in this field.
sentences.chinese: 他是这个领域的革新者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who introduces changes and new ideas

name: melodic
trans: adj. 有旋律的；音调优美的

sentences.english: Their music is loud and not very melodic.
sentences.chinese: 他们的音乐很响，而且不大悦耳。

sentences.english: a deep melodic voice
sentences.chinese: 低沉悦耳的嗓音

detailed_translations.english: something that sounds melodic sounds like music or has a pleasant tune

name: scat
trans: v. 走开，离开；用拟声唱法唱 n. 拟声唱法；（尤指食肉动物的）粪便；金钱鱼 int. 嘘（赶猫等的呼声）

detailed_translations.english: to go away in haste

detailed_translations.chinese: 爵士音乐中无意义的音节的演唱

name: spontaneity
trans: n. 自发性；自然发生

sentences.english: He had the spontaneity of a child.
sentences.chinese: 他有孩子般的自然举动。

detailed_translations.english: Spontaneity is spontaneous, natural behaviour

name: eloquent
trans: adj. 意味深长的；雄辩的，有口才的；有说服力的；动人的

sentences.english: an eloquent appeal for support
sentences.chinese: 极具说服力的求助呼吁

detailed_translations.english: able to express your ideas and opinions well, especially in a way that influences people

name: glacier
trans: n. 冰河，冰川

sentences.english: The glacier calved a large iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 冰川崩解而产生一个大冰山。

sentences.english: The glacier dislocated great stones.
sentences.chinese: 冰川使许多大石块移位了。

sentences.english: A river or glacier debouches on the plains.
sentences.chinese: 一条河流或冰川流向平原。

detailed_translations.english: a large mass of ice which moves slowly down a mountain valley

name: naturalist
trans: n. 自然主义者；博物学者；（英）动物标本剥制者；买卖玩赏动物的商人 adj. 自然的（等于naturalistic）；自然主义的；博物学的

sentences.english: I am sometimes described as a naturalist.
sentences.chinese: 有时我也被称作自然主义者。

sentences.english: An American naturalist wrote:"a patriot must always be ready to defend his country against its government".
sentences.chinese: 一位美国自然主义者写道：“爱国者要随时准备好为了保卫国家而与政府斗争！”

sentences.english: To illustrate this, let me refer to the naturalist science of the 19th century, and the effects it had on our opinions of life.
sentences.chinese: 为了诠释这点，我要引用下19世纪的自然主义科学及其它对我们的生活观念所产生的影响。

name: passion
trans: n. 激情；热情；酷爱；盛怒

sentences.english: The issue arouses strong passions.
sentences.chinese: 那件事激起了人们强烈的情绪。

sentences.english: Gardening was her great passion.
sentences.chinese: 她酷爱园艺。

detailed_translations.chinese: 强烈的情感，激情；强烈的爱好，热爱
detailed_translations.english: a very strong belief or feeling about something

name: protect
trans: vt. 保护，防卫；警戒

sentences.english: Are we doing enough to protect the environment?
sentences.chinese: 我们在保护环境方面做得够吗？

detailed_translations.english: to keep someone or something safe from harm, damage, or illness

name: federal
trans: adj. 联邦的；同盟的；联邦政府的； 联邦制的 adv. 联邦政府地 n. (Federal)人名；(英)费德勒尔

sentences.english: Switzerland is a federal republic.
sentences.chinese: 瑞士是一个联邦共和国。

detailed_translations.english: a federal country or system of government consists of a group of states which control their own affairs, but which are also controlled by a single national government which makes decisions on foreign affairs, defence etc

name: interpret
trans: vt. 说明；口译 vi. 解释；翻译

sentences.english: They spoke good Spanish, and promised to interpret for me.
sentences.chinese: 他们西班牙语说得很好，答应替我翻译。

sentences.english: Freud’s attempts to interpret the meaning of dreams
sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德对梦的含义的解析

detailed_translations.english: to translate spoken words from one language into another

name: judicial
trans: adj. 公正的，明断的；法庭的；审判上的

sentences.english: ...an independent judicial system.
sentences.chinese: …一个独立的司法体系。

sentences.english: ...efforts to manipulate the judicial process.
sentences.chinese: …操纵审判程序的努力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 公正的，明断的；法庭的；审判上的
detailed_translations.english: Judicial means relating to the legal system and to judgments made in a court of law

name: lawsuit
trans: n. 诉讼（尤指非刑事案件）；诉讼案件

sentences.english: The dispute culminated last week in a lawsuit against the government.
sentences.chinese: 这场针对政府诉讼案的争论在上星期达到了高潮。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or complaint that a person or organization brings to a court of law to be settled

name: ruling
trans: n. （尤指法庭的）裁定；统治，支配 adj. 统治的，支配的；主导的；流行的，普遍的

sentences.english: Goodwin tried to have the court ruling overturned.
sentences.chinese: 古德温试图推翻法院的裁决。

detailed_translations.english: an official decision, especially one made by a court

name: aeronautics
trans: n. 航空学；飞行术

sentences.english: Although it was a great hobby for her, she wanted to study aeronautics or astronomy as a career.
sentences.chinese: 不过这只是她一大爱好，她本想学习航空或天文作为职业。

detailed_translations.english: the science of designing and flying planes

name: calculation
trans: n. 计算；估计；计算的结果；深思熟虑

sentences.english: Cathy did a rough calculation.
sentences.chinese: 凯茜作了一个粗略的计算。

detailed_translations.english: the act or process of using numbers to find out an amount

name: dignity
trans: n. 尊严；高贵

sentences.english: We do this because we believe in the dignity and value of every person.
sentences.chinese: 我们这样做是因为我们相信每个人的尊严和价值。

sentences.english: They have to be treated well, with dignity.
sentences.chinese: 必须善待申请人，让人有尊严。

sentences.english: This award must be shared with everyone who strives for justice and dignity.
sentences.chinese: 我一定要与所有为正义和尊严奋斗的人分享此奖。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to behave in a calm controlled way even in a difficult situation

name: mathematician
trans: n. 数学家 善作数字计算的人

sentences.english: The risks can be so complex that banks hire mathematicians to assess them.
sentences.chinese: 这类风险可以是如此复杂以至于银行雇佣数学家们去评估它们。

detailed_translations.english: someone who studies or teaches mathematics, or is a specialist in mathematics

name: labor
trans: n. 劳动；工作；劳工；分娩 vi. 劳动；努力；苦干 vt. 详细分析；使厌烦 n. (Labor)人名；(德、塞、法)拉博尔；(英)拉博

sentences.english: I should assign you your share of labor, and compel you to accomplish it.
sentences.chinese: 我要把属于你的那份劳动分配给你，并且强迫你完成它。

sentences.english: For the happiness of human labor, this is how magnificent cause, this goal is how great!
sentences.chinese: 为人类的幸福而劳动，这是多么壮丽的事业，这个目标有多么伟大！

sentences.english: However, after years of labor in their chosen field, they begin to hate their jobs.
sentences.chinese: 然而，他们在选择的领域工作了几年后，便开始痛恨自己的工作。

name: negotiate
trans: vt. 谈判，商议；转让；越过 vi. 谈判，交涉

sentences.english: His first aim is to get the warring parties back to the negotiating table (= discussing something ).
sentences.chinese: 他的首要目标就是把交战各方拉回到谈判桌上。

detailed_translations.english: to discuss something in order to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics

name: right
trans: adj. 正确的；直接的；右方的 vi. 复正；恢复平稳 n. 正确；右边；正义；权利 adv. 正确地；恰当地；彻底地 vt. 纠正 n. (Right)人名；(英)赖特

sentences.english: Yes, that’s the right answer .
sentences.chinese: 对，回答正确。

sentences.english: Is that the right time ?
sentences.chinese: 那个时间对吗？

sentences.english: I got most of the questions right .
sentences.chinese: 大部分问题我都答对了。

sentences.english: His ideas have now been proved right .
sentences.chinese: 他的观点现已证明是对的。

detailed_translations.english: a statement or piece of information that is right is correct and based on true facts

exactly in a particular position or place

trans: n. 工资；报酬；代价；报应 v. 进行，发动（运动、战争等）；开展 n. (Wage) （美）伟杰（人名）

sentences.chinese: 他一直是我灵感的源泉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 灵感； 鼓舞人心的人

sentences.chinese: 出版社计划将这份杂志做成周刊。

sentences.chinese: 氢是一价的元素。

sentences.chinese: …物理学定律。

sentences.chinese: 如何处理放射性废物的问题

sentences.english: a consignment of highly radioactive plutonium

name: experiment
trans: n. 实验，试验；尝试 v. 尝试；试验；进行实验

sentences.english: The teacher provided some different materials and left the children to experiment.
sentences.chinese: 老师提供了几种不同的材料让孩子们试验。

detailed_translations.english: to try using various ideas, methods etc to find out how good or effective they are
a scientific test done to find out how something reacts under certain conditions, or to find out if a particular idea is true

name: fighter
trans: n. 战士，斗争者；斗士；奋斗者；好战者

sentences.english: He was shot down by enemy fighters.
sentences.chinese: 他被敌军战斗机击落。

sentences.english: James is a fighter - he never gives up.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯是个顽强拼搏的人——他从不放弃。

detailed_translations.english: a small fast military plane that can destroy other planes

name: segregated
trans: adj. 被隔离的 v. 隔离（segregate的过去式）；分离

name: World War II
trans: 第二次世界大战

sentences.english: This is quite an amazing feat seeing as how it had to rise up after the end of World War II when it found itself almost destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 日本在第二次世界大战结束时几乎完全摧毁，看到它能如此迅速地崛起，这可真算得上是一个令人吃惊的业绩。

sentences.english: Surf and spray scatter as a large wave crashes onto the shore in Palau. More than 250 islands make up the country, a Japanese stronghold during World War II.
sentences.chinese: 作为巨大波涛的海浪和浪花崩溃在帕劳的海岸，由250多个岛屿组成国家，这些岛屿是第二次世界大战期间日本的据点。

name: advisor
trans: n. 顾问；指导教师；劝告者

sentences.english: This is the role of the coach, advisor, or teacher.
sentences.chinese: 这就是教练、顾问或者老师所扮演的角色。

sentences.english: When you purchase stocks, or equities, as your advisor might put it, you become a part owner of the business.
sentences.chinese: 当你买入股票或者等价物，你的顾问会告诉你说你已经成为了企业的部分所有者。

name: agency
trans: n. 代理，中介；代理处，经销处；作用

sentences.english: a UN agency responsible for helping refugees
sentences.chinese: 负责为难民提供帮助的联合国机构

sentences.english: the Environmental Protection Agency
sentences.chinese: 环保局

detailed_translations.english: an organization or department, especially within a government, that does a specific job

name: executive
trans: adj. 经营管理的；有执行权的；高级的；供重要人物使用的 n. 主管；行政领导；（政府的）行政部门；执行委员会

sentences.english: a commission with executive powers
sentences.chinese: 有执行权的委员会

detailed_translations.english: relating to the job of managing a business or organization and making decisions
a group of people who are in charge of an organization and make the rules

name: expert
trans: n. 专家；行家；能手 adj. 熟练的；内行的；老练的 v. 当专家 n. (Expert) （法、印、俄、罗、巴、荷）埃克斯佩（人名）

sentences.english: ...a yoga expert.
sentences.chinese: …一位瑜伽专家。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has a special skill or special knowledge of a subject, gained as a result of training or experience

name: security
trans: n. 安全，安全性；保证；证券；抵押品 adj. 安全的；保安的；保密的

sentences.english: The trial was held under tight security .
sentences.chinese: 这场审讯是在戒备森严的情况下进行的。

sentences.english: lax security at airline check-in desks
sentences.chinese: 登机手续柜台松懈的安全措施

sentences.english: terrorist activity that is a threat to national security
sentences.chinese: 威胁国家安全的恐怖活动

sentences.english: The prison was ordered to tighten security after a prisoner escaped yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 昨天一名囚犯越狱后，该监狱被勒令加强安全措施。

sentences.english: The Security Commission investigates breaches of security .
sentences.chinese: 安全委员会对违反安全规定的事项进行调查。

sentences.english: We have been asked not to say anything for security reasons .
sentences.chinese: 出于安全考虑，我们被要求守口如瓶。

sentences.english: The security forces opened fire, killing two people.
sentences.chinese: 保安部队开枪打死了两个人。

sentences.english: The thief was caught on a security camera .
sentences.chinese: 小偷被保安摄像机当场拍了下来。

sentences.english: There are strict security checks on everyone entering the Opera House.
sentences.chinese: 每个人进入歌剧院都要接受严格的安全检查。

sentences.english: A large number of homes lack adequate security measures .
sentences.chinese: 许多住宅都未采取足够的安全措施。

detailed_translations.english: things that are done to keep a person, building, or country safe from danger or crime

name: atmosphere
trans: n. 气氛；大气；空气

sentences.english: The hotel had a lovely relaxed atmosphere .
sentences.chinese: 那家宾馆的气氛轻松愉快。

sentences.english: The atmosphere at home was rather tense.
sentences.chinese: 家里的气氛很紧张。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that an event or place gives you

name: equator
trans: n. 赤道

sentences.english: The United States is north of the equator.
sentences.chinese: 美国位于赤道以北。

sentences.english: In the hot zone near the equator the sun heats the air continually; hence the air there ascends.
sentences.chinese: 在靠近赤道的热带地区，太阳不断地加热那里的空气，于是那里的热空气就上升。

detailed_translations.english: an imaginary line drawn around the middle of the Earth that is exactly the same distance from the North Pole and the South Pole

name: hostile
trans: adj. 敌对的，敌方的；怀敌意的 n. 敌对

sentences.english: Southampton fans gave their former coach a hostile reception .
sentences.chinese: 南安普敦队的球迷对球队的前任教练很不友善。

sentences.english: Carr wouldn’t meet Feng’s stare, which was openly hostile .
sentences.chinese: 卡尔不愿意面对冯公然敌视的目光。

sentences.english: his hostile attitude
sentences.chinese: 他敌对的态度

detailed_translations.english: angry and deliberately unfriendly towards someone, and ready to argue with them

name: opaque
trans: adj. 不透明的；不传热的；迟钝的 n. 不透明物 vt. 使不透明；使不反光

sentences.english: a shower with an opaque glass door
sentences.chinese: 装有不透明玻璃门的淋浴间

detailed_translations.chinese: 不透明的；不传热的；迟钝的
detailed_translations.english: opaque glass or liquid is difficult to see through and often thick

name: radar
trans: n. [雷达] 雷达，无线电探测器 n. (Radar)人名；(塞)拉达尔

sentences.english: The coastline can now be monitored by radar.
sentences.chinese: 现在能用雷达监测海岸线了。

sentences.english: We could see the plane quite clearly on the radar screen.
sentences.chinese: 我们在雷达屏幕上可清晰地看到飞机。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that uses radio waves to find the position of things and watch their movement

name: dormant
trans: adj. 休眠的；静止的；睡眠状态的；隐匿的 n. (Dormant)人名；(法)多尔芒

sentences.english: a huge dormant volcano
sentences.chinese: 一座巨大的休眠火山

detailed_translations.chinese: 休眠的；静止的；睡眠状态的；隐匿的
detailed_translations.english: not active or not growing at the present time but able to be active later

name: geothermal
trans: adj. [地物] 地热的；[地物] 地温的

sentences.english: a geothermal energy plant
sentences.chinese: 地热能工厂

detailed_translations.english: relating to or coming from the heat inside the Earth

name: magma
trans: n. [地质] 岩浆；糊剂 n. (Magma)人名；(英)马格马

sentences.english: The volcano threw new showers of magma and ash into the air.
sentences.chinese: 这座火山向空气中喷发了新的岩浆和火山灰。

detailed_translations.english: hot melted rock below the surface of the Earth

name: seismic
trans: adj. 地震的；因地震而引起的

sentences.english: increased seismic activity
sentences.chinese: 越来越频繁的地震活动

detailed_translations.chinese: 地震的；因地震而引起的
detailed_translations.english: relating to or caused by  earthquakes

name: colonial
trans: adj. 殖民的，殖民地的；（建筑，家具）殖民地时期式样的；（动物，植物）群体的；受英国殖民统治时期的 n. 殖民地居民；殖民地时期式样的房屋

sentences.english: the struggle against colonial rule
sentences.chinese: 反抗殖民统治的斗争

sentences.english: Britain was the largest colonial power .
sentences.chinese: 英国曾是最大的殖民强国。

detailed_translations.english: relating to a country that controls and rules other countries, usually ones that are far away

name: fort
trans: n. 堡垒；要塞；（美）边界贸易站 vt. 设要塞保卫 vi. 构筑要塞 n. (Fort)人名；(法)福尔；(德、英、西、葡、匈)福特

sentences.english: The fort flanked on a swamp.
sentences.chinese: 堡垒侧面靠着沼泽。

detailed_translations.english: a strong building or group of buildings used by soldiers or an army for defending an important place

name: invade
trans: vt. 侵略；侵袭；侵扰；涌入 vi. 侵略；侵入；侵袭；侵犯

sentences.english: The Romans invaded Britain 2,000 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 2,000年前古罗马人入侵了英国。

detailed_translations.english: to enter a country, town, or area using military force, in order to take control of it

name: surrender
trans: vt. 使投降；放弃；交出；听任 vi. 投降；屈服；自首 n. 投降；放弃；交出；屈服

sentences.english: Germany surrendered on May 7th, 1945.
sentences.chinese: 德国于 1945 年 5 月 7 日投降。

sentences.english: The terrorists were given ten minutes to surrender.
sentences.chinese: 恐怖分子被限定在十分钟之内投降。

detailed_translations.english: to say officially that you want to stop fighting, because you realize that you cannot win
to give up something or someone, especially because you are forced to
when you say officially that you want to stop fighting because you realize that you cannot win

name: territory
trans: n. 领土，领域；范围；地域；版图

sentences.english: Hong Kong is a Chinese territory.
sentences.chinese: 香港是中国的领土。

sentences.english: The company is moving into unfamiliar territory with this new software.
sentences.chinese: 该公司正通过这种新软件进入一个不熟悉的领域。

detailed_translations.english: land that is owned or controlled by a particular country, ruler, or military force

name: Arctic
trans: adj. 北极的；极寒的 n. 北极圈；御寒防水套鞋 n. (Arctic)人名；(英)阿克蒂克

sentences.english: the Arctic island of Novaya Zemlya
sentences.chinese: 北极的新地岛

sentences.english: ...winter in the Arctic.
sentences.chinese: …北极的冬天。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the most northern part of the world
The Arctic is the area of the world around the North Pole. It is extremely cold and there is very little light in winter and very little darkness in summer.

name: dispute
trans: n. 辩论；争吵；意见不同 v. 辩论；对……进行质疑；争夺；抵抗（进攻）

sentences.english: It is beyond dispute that advances in medicine have enabled people to live longer.
sentences.chinese: 医学的发展使人们更加长寿，这是无可置疑的。

sentences.english: What happened next is hotly disputed .
sentences.chinese: 关于后来发生了什么，争论很激烈。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument or disagreement
to argue or disagree with someone

name: petroleum
trans: n. 石油

sentences.english: petroleum-based products
sentences.chinese: 石油产品

detailed_translations.english: oil that is obtained from below the surface of the Earth and is used to make petrol,  paraffin  , and various chemical substances

name: route
trans: n. 路线，航线；道路，公路；（交通工具的）固定路线；巡访；途径，渠道；（北美）递送路线；用于美国干线公路号码前 v. 按特定路线发送，为……规定路线

sentences.english: Trains are taking a lot of freight that used to be routed via trucks.
sentences.chinese: 火车正在运送过去由卡车运送的大批货物。

detailed_translations.english: to send something somewhere using a particular route
a way from one place to another

name: function
trans: n. 功能；[数] 函数；职责；盛大的集会 vi. 运行；活动；行使职责

sentences.english: Her legs have now ceased to function .
sentences.chinese: 她的双腿现在已经丧失正常功能了。

sentences.english: You know I can’t function (= cannot perform normal activities ) without a coffee in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 你知道的，我早上不喝杯咖啡就无法工作。

detailed_translations.chinese: 工作， 运行； 起作用
detailed_translations.english: to work in the correct or intended way

detailed_translations.chinese: 功能，职务；【数】函数；重大聚会
detailed_translations.english: the purpose that something has, or the job that someone or something does

name: restore
trans: vt. 恢复；修复；归还 vi. 恢复；还原

sentences.english: She was hoping that the Mediterranean climate would restore her to full health.
sentences.chinese: 她希望地中海的气候能使她的身体完全复原。

sentences.english: The National Guard was called in to restore order (= make people stop fighting and breaking the law ) when riots broke out.
sentences.chinese: 暴乱爆发后，国民警卫队被调来恢复秩序。

sentences.english: initiatives to restore peace in the Middle East
sentences.chinese: 恢复中东和平的倡议

sentences.english: a Victorian fireplace restored to its former glory
sentences.chinese: 恢复了昔日华美的维多利亚时代的壁炉

sentences.english: The treaty restored Okinawa to Japan.
sentences.chinese: 该条约将冲绳归还给了日本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something return to its former state or condition

name: schedule
trans: n. 计划（表）；时间表；一览表；（电视或广播）节目表；课程表；报税单；附件（尤指表格、单据等） v. 安排，预定；将……列入计划表或清单；把（建筑物）列为文物保护单位

sentences.english: How can he fit everything into his busy schedule ?
sentences.chinese: 他是怎么把所有的事情都排进自己忙碌的时间表的？

sentences.english: I’m going to be working to a very tight schedule (= including a lot of things that must be done in a short time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的工作安排将会非常紧。

detailed_translations.english: a plan of what someone is going to do and when they are going to do it

name: extension
trans: n. 延长；延期；扩大；伸展；电话分机

sentences.english: Can I have extension 316, please?
sentences.chinese: 能帮我接316号分机吗？

detailed_translations.english: one of many telephone lines connected to a central system in a large building, which all have different numbers

name: fashion
trans: n. 时尚；时装；样式；方式；时髦人物 vt. 使用；改变；做成…的形状

sentences.english: Their music will never go out of fashion (= stop being fashionable ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的音乐永不过时。

sentences.english: Please leave the building in an orderly fashion.
sentences.chinese: 请大家有秩序地离开大楼。

sentences.english: Perhaps they could sit down and discuss things in a civilised fashion.
sentences.chinese: 也许他们可以坐下来心平气和地商量事情。

sentences.english: She will be working out her problems in her own fashion (= in the way that she usually does this ) .
sentences.chinese: 她会以自己的方式来解决她的问题。

detailed_translations.english: something that is popular or thought to be good at a particular time

name: fiber
trans: n. 纤维（等于 fibre） n. (Fiber) （匈）菲贝尔（人名）

sentences.english: And remember nuts like almonds with their skins on have more fiber than those without.
sentences.chinese: 记住，向杏仁那样有皮的坚果比那些没有皮的更富含纤维素。

sentences.english: While they bite into the fruit, they could savor the various blends of fiber and juices.
sentences.chinese: 当他们咬一口水果，他们可以尝到各种水果纤维和汁液的混合。

sentences.english: Not only do they offer antioxidants, they contain higher content of vitamins, minerals, and fiber.
sentences.chinese: 它们不仅提供抗氧化剂，还含有较高含量的维生素、矿物质和纤维。

name: ornate
trans: adj. 华丽的；装饰的；（文体）绚丽的

sentences.english: an ornate gold mirror
sentences.chinese: 华丽的金镜子

detailed_translations.chinese: 华丽的；装饰的；（文体）绚丽的
detailed_translations.english: covered with a lot of decoration

name: toupee
trans: n. 假发；男子假发

name: wig
trans: n. 假发；要人；头脑 vt. 使戴假发；斥责 vi. 激动；发狂 n. (Wig)人名；(英、瑞典)威格；(德)维希

sentences.english: Jo wore a long wig that made her look very sexy.
sentences.chinese: 乔带着一头长长的假发，使她看起来很性感。

detailed_translations.english: artificial hair that you wear on your head

name: amendment
trans: n. 修正案；改善；改正

sentences.english: constitutional amendments
sentences.chinese: 宪法修正案

detailed_translations.english: a small change, improvement, or addition that is made to a law or document, or the process of doing this

name: Constitution
trans: n. 宪法；体制；章程；构造；建立，组成；体格

name: election
trans: n. 选举；当选；选择权；上帝的选拔

sentences.english: The Labour Party won the 2001 election by a huge majority.
sentences.chinese: 工党在2001年选举中以巨大优势获胜。

sentences.english: Elections for the state governorship will be on November 25.
sentences.chinese: 州长选举将于11月25日举行。

detailed_translations.english: when people vote to choose someone for an official position

name: injustice
trans: n. 不公正；不讲道义

sentences.english: The movie deals with injustices suffered by Native Americans.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影讲述印第安人受到的不公正待遇。

sentences.english: He had developed a deep sense of social injustice.
sentences.chinese: 他深深感到社会的不公。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people are treated very unfairly and not given their rights

name: movement
trans: n. 运动；活动；运转；乐章

sentences.english: the dancer’s graceful movements
sentences.chinese: 舞蹈演员优美的动作

sentences.english: reports of troop movements in the area
sentences.chinese: 该地区部队动向的报告

detailed_translations.english: when someone or something changes position or moves from one place to another

name: suffragist
trans: n. 妇女政权论者；参政权扩大论者

detailed_translations.chinese: 参政权扩大论者； 妇女政权论者
detailed_translations.english: A suffragist is a person who is in favour of women having the right to vote, especially in societies where women are not allowed to vote

name: consonant
trans: adj. 辅音的；一致的；和谐的 n. 辅音；辅音字母

sentences.english: This policy is scarcely consonant with the government’s declared aims.
sentences.chinese: 这项政策与政府所宣称的目标基本上不符。

detailed_translations.english: relating to a combination of musical notes that sounds pleasant
a speech sound made by partly or completely stopping the flow of air through your mouth

name: palindrome
trans: n. 回文

name: phonics
trans: n. 声学；拼读法，声音基础教学法

name: pun
trans: n. 双关语，俏皮话 v. 说双关语，说俏皮话；把（泥土，碎石等）击打成团 n. (Pun) （美、港）汶（人名）

sentences.english: I could be cynical and say he probably did it hoping to make a killing -- pardon the pun -- but for the sake of the higher argument I'll play along.
sentences.chinese: 我也许可以玩世不恭的说他这么做是希望开发出一个在市场上“必杀”的游戏——请原谅我的双关语——但为了更高层的论题，我权且同意他的话。

detailed_translations.english: to make a pun
an amusing use of a word or phrase that has two meanings, or of words that have the same sound but different meanings

name: simile
trans: n. 明喻；直喻

sentences.english: In Book One alone there are four primary instances of what we can think of as this primary simile dynamic.
sentences.chinese: 仅第一本里就有四个主要的例证,我们可以看作最初的明喻来源的动力。

sentences.english: Lister said people should follow the 1946 advice of writer George Orwell: "Never use a metaphor, simile, or other figure of speech which you are used to seeing in print.
sentences.chinese: 李斯特说人们最好遵循作家乔治·奥威尔1946年提出的建议：“不要使用那些在各种出版物上频繁出现的暗喻、明喻或其他修辞格。”

sentences.english: The simile is a common device and a useful one, but similes coming in rapid fire, one right on top of another, are more distracting than illuminating.
sentences.chinese: 明喻是常用的修辞术，也很好用，但是像连珠炮式的比喻与其说是富有启发性，不如说是在转移注意力。

detailed_translations.english: an expression that describes something by comparing it with something else, using the words ‘as’ or ‘like’, for example ‘as white as snow’

name: syntax
trans: n. 语法；句法；有秩序的排列

sentences.english: His grammar and syntax, both in oral and written expression, were much better than the average.
sentences.chinese: 无论在口头还是笔头上，他的语法和句法都非常出众。

detailed_translations.chinese: 语法；句法；有秩序的排列
detailed_translations.english: the way words are arranged to form sentences or phrases, or the rules of grammar which control this

name: fauna
trans: n. 动物群；[动] 动物区系 n. (Fauna)人名；(瑞典)福纳

sentences.english: ...the flora and fauna of the African jungle.
sentences.chinese: …非洲丛林的植物群和动物群。

detailed_translations.english: all the animals living in a particular area or period in history

name: oath
trans: n. 誓言，誓约；诅咒，咒骂

sentences.english: The president took the oath of office (= made the official public promises that every president makes when starting their job ) .
sentences.chinese: 总统宣誓就职。

sentences.english: She could not break her oath .
sentences.chinese: 她不能违背誓言。

detailed_translations.english: a formal and very serious promise

name: preserve
trans: vt. 保存；保护；维持；腌；禁猎 n. 保护区；禁猎地；加工成的食品；（某人或群体的）专门活动

sentences.english: We must encourage the planting of new trees and preserve our existing woodlands.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须鼓励栽种新树木，同时也要保护现有的林地。

detailed_translations.english: to save something or someone from being harmed or destroyed

name: recite
trans: vt. 背诵；叙述；列举 vi. 背诵；叙述

sentences.english: She recited a poem that she had learnt at school.
sentences.chinese: 她背诵了一首学校里学的诗。

detailed_translations.english: to say a poem, piece of literature etc that you have learned, for people to listen to
